recommendations.suggestion: Dedicated to preventing boating tragedies through education, awareness, and honoring the radiant spirit of Stephanie Marie Rodriguez.
Keep Her Light Alive.
Promoting boating safety awareness across Florida to prevent tragedies on the water.

Our
                        foundation provides water safety education, resources, and community support - in loving memory
                        of
                        Stephanie M.
The Coin Initiative Our Mission.

The
                            Mission Awareness.
"We believe that water safety education saves lives.

Our foundation was born from a desire
                            to prevent boating accidents and ensure no other family endures the pain of a preventable
                            loss on Florida's waters.

" Boating Accident Prevention Through advocacy for stricter boating regulations and free safety courses in
                                    Miami-Dade, we're working to change the culture of water recreation in South Florida
                                    and prevent preventable boating accidents.

Support for Affected Families Beyond safety resources, we provide emotional support and community connection for
                                    families affected by boating accidents in Florida, offering hope and healing during
                                    difficult times.

In
                        Loving Memory Stephanie's Light On November 7, 2024 , a preventable boating
                            accident in the Florida Keys took the life of Stephanie Marie Rodriguez, a 24-year-old woman
                            whose light touched everyone she met.

She wasn't just a daughter, sister, and friend; she
                            was the person who remembered your birthday, who showed up when you needed her most, who
                            made strangers feel like family.
Stephanie had dreams of becoming a nurse, driven by her deep desire to care for others.

She
                            loved the ocean, sunset boat rides with friends, and the simple joy of being surrounded by
                            the people she cherished.

Her laughter was contagious, her kindness boundless, and her
                            presence made every room brighter.

That November evening was supposed to be another beautiful memory - a day on the water with
                            friends, celebrating life.

Instead, it became a tragedy that shattered four families and an
                            entire community.
The accident was preventable.
The safety measures were absent.

And in an
                            instant, the world lost someone irreplaceable.
Her passing ignited a spark in those who loved her most.

Her mother, Magaly, along with
                            close friends Midalys, Vivian, and Natalie, refused to let her memory fade into silence.

They founded Keep Her Light Alive - not just as a memorial, but as a mission to ensure no
                            other family experiences this preventable heartbreak.

Through boating safety advocacy,
                            education, and community support, we're working to protect lives across Florida and honor
                            the spirit of a young woman who gave so much love to the world.
"Stephanie's light didn't dim when she left us - it multiplied.

Every life we save,
                                every
                                family we educate, every act of kindness we inspire carries her spirit forward.

Our
                            Impact Pillars
                            of Action Our water safety initiatives create real change through education, advocacy, and community
                        connection across South Florida.

Free Boating Safety
                                Courses Partnering with local authorities in Miami-Dade and the Florida Keys to provide free
                                water safety resources, pre-departure checklists, and boating safety workshops for
                                families.

Join the
                                Movement Learn
                                more about the Coin → Water Safety Events
                                in Florida From memorial walks to boating safety seminars in Hialeah and Miami, we bring the
                                community together for healing and education.

Florida Boating
                                Safety Advocacy Advocating for
                                stricter boating safety laws and
                                regulations in Florida to help prevent accidents and ensure every boat trip ends safely.

Community Events &
                        Gatherings Join us in our mission to celebrate life and promote safety.
Upcoming Events Feb 14 Fundraiser Light the Night Gala An elegant evening of remembrance and hope.

Join us for a charity dinner to support
                                    our
                                    educational programs and victim assistance fund.
Reserve Tickets Mar 05 Education Safe Waters Workshop A hands-on boating safety course for all ages.

Learn proper life jacket use,
                                    navigation
                                    rules, and emergency protocols.
Register Free Past Highlights November 2025 Community Event Inaugural Memorial Walk Over 500 community members gathered at sunset to walk 5k in memory of lost loved ones.

The
                                event raised funds for 300 life jackets donated to local youth centers.

View
                                Photo Gallery.

Spread
                            Kindness The Coin Initiative Inspired by Stephanie’s boundless generosity, this coin is a symbol of purposeless kindness.

One
                            side bears our promise: "Keep Her Light Alive," while
                            the
                            other connects you to a community of good deeds.

When you receive this coin, hold it, scan it, and then pass it on by performing a random act
                            of
                            kindness.
Let the ripple effect begin.
Request a Coin.

Education Water Safety
                            Resources Essential boating safety guides, pre-departure checklists, and life jacket guidelines to
                            help Florida families prepare for a safe day on the water.
Download, print, and share.

Get
                            Involved Join Our Water
                            Safety Mission Whether you want to volunteer at boating safety events, sponsor an initiative, or share your
                            story, we're here to connect and help prevent future tragedies.
Location Florida, United States Email Keepherlightalivesmr@gmail.
com Phone 786-486-8120 Name Email Subject General Inquiry Volunteering Donation Support Press / Media Message Send Message.
Questions Frequently Asked Questions Everything you need to know about our foundation and how you can help.
What is Keep Her Light Alive Foundation.

We are a nonprofit organization dedicated to preventing boating accidents through
                                education, advocacy, and community support.

Founded in memory of Stephanie Marie
                                Rodriguez, we work to ensure no family experiences the preventable tragedy of losing a
                                loved one on the water.
How can I get a Coin of Kindness.
You can request a coin through our contact form or at any of our events.

Each coin is
                                free and comes with a simple mission: perform an act of kindness, then pass it on.

The
                                QR code on the back lets you track the coin's journey and see the ripple effect of good
                                deeds.
How can I support the foundation.

There are many ways to help: volunteer at our events, sponsor a safety workshop, share
                                our resources with boaters in your community, or make a donation.

Every contribution
                                helps us provide free safety education and support families affected by boating
                                accidents.
Are your boating safety courses really free.
All our safety courses, workshops, and educational resources are completely free.

We believe that financial barriers should never prevent anyone from learning life-saving
                                water safety skills.
Where do you operate.

We primarily serve South Florida, including Miami-Dade County, Hialeah, and the Florida
                                Keys.

However, our educational resources are available to anyone, and we're working to
                                expand our reach throughout Florida.
How can I share my story or get support.

If you or your family have been affected by a boating accident, please reach out through
                                our contact form or call us directly.

We provide emotional support, connect families
                                with resources, and offer a compassionate community of people who understand your
                                experience.
